alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 4:02PM PST until March 01 at 11:36PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Green River Near Auburn affecting King County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skykomish River Near Gold Bar affecting Snohomish County. Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County. Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County. Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County. Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls affecting King County. .Showers will diminish today and will not contribute to rising river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Skykomish River Near Gold Bar. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river fell below flood stage early this afternoon and will continue to fall. Flooding will continue until the flood wave moves completely downstream out of the area. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.7 feet on 01/23/1934. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1145 PM PST.
